topic: How to combine gc with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine gc with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Leveraging Garbage Collection and Type Hinting in Production Code (Python 3.12+)
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates the strategic utilization of Garbage Collection (gc) and Type Hinting features in Python 3.12+, enhancing the efficiency and maintainability of production code.
key_points: Understanding Garbage Collection behavior in Python 3.12+
Utilizing type hints for improved code clarity and safety
Combining gc with type hinting to optimize memory usage
Exploring practical examples of using these features in production code

code_examples.code:
from typing import Any, Callable

gc: Callable[..., None] = gc.enable
# ... (use gc here)
gc()

version_notes: Recommended to use a recent release for best performance and feature compatibility
caveats: Incorrect usage of gc may lead to unintended memory consumption issues
Type hints do not affect runtime performance but improve code readability and safety
